net.coobird.thumbnailator
Class Thumbnails

java.lang.Object
  net.coobird.thumbnailator.Thumbnails

public final class Thumbnails
extends Object

This class provides a fluent interface to create thumbnails.

Usage:
The following example code demonstrates how to use the fluent interface to create a thumbnail from multiple files from a directory, resizing them to a maximum of 200 pixels by 200 pixels while preserving the aspect ratio of the original, then saving the resulting thumbnails as JPEG images with file names having thumbnail. appended to the beginning of the file name. 

Thumbnails.of(directory.listFiles())
    .size(200, 200)
    .keepAspectRatio(true)
    .outputFormat("jpeg")
    .asFiles(Rename.PREFIX_DOT_THUMBNAIL);

Author:
coobird

Field Detail

PREFIX_HYPTHEN_THUMBNAIL_RENAME

@Deprecated
public static final Thumbnails.Rename PREFIX_HYPTHEN_THUMBNAIL_RENAME
Deprecated. This constant has been moved to the Rename class, and is subject to removal in future versions of Thumbnailator.
Appends thumbnail- to the beginning of the file name.

Example
  • Before: picture.jpg
  • After: thumbnail-picture.jpg

SUFFIX_HYPTHEN_THUMBNAIL_RENAME

@Deprecated
public static final Thumbnails.Rename SUFFIX_HYPTHEN_THUMBNAIL_RENAME
Deprecated. This constant has been moved to the Rename class, and is subject to removal in future versions of Thumbnailator.
Appends -thumbnail to the file name prior to the extension of the file.

Example
  • Before: picture.jpg
  • After: picture-thumbnail.jpg

Method Detail

createThumbnailCollection

@Deprecated
public static Collection<File> createThumbnailCollection(Collection<? extends File> files,
                                                                    Thumbnails.Rename rename,
                                                                    int width,
                                                                    int height)
                                                  throws IOException
Deprecated. This method has been moved to the Thumbnailator class, and is subject to removal in future versions of Thumbnailator.

Creates thumbnails from a specified Collection of Files. The filenames of the resulting thumbnails are determined by applying the specified Thumbnails.Rename.

The order of the thumbnail Files in the returned Collection will be the same as the order as the source list.

Parameters:
files - A Collection containing File objects of image files.
rename - The renaming function to use.
width - The width of the thumbnail.
height - The height of the thumbnail.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown when a problem occurs when reading from File representing an image file.

createThumbnail

@Deprecated
public static void createThumbnail(File inFile,
                                              File outFile,
                                              int width,
                                              int height)
                            throws IOException
Deprecated. This method has been moved to the Thumbnailator class, and is subject to removal in future versions of Thumbnailator.

Creates a thumbnail from an source image and writes the thumbnail to a destination file.

The image format to use for the thumbnail will be determined from the file extension. However, if the image format cannot be determined, then, the same image format as the original image will be used when writing the thumbnail.

Parameters:
inFile - The File from which image data is read.
outFile - The File to which thumbnail is written.
width - The width of the thumbnail.
height - The height of the thumbnail.
Throws:
IOException - Thrown when a problem occurs when reading from File representing an image file.

createThumbnail

@Deprecated
public static BufferedImage createThumbnail(BufferedImage img,
                                                       int width,
                                                       int height)
Deprecated. This method has been moved to the Thumbnailator class, and is subject to removal in future versions of Thumbnailator.

Creates a thumbnail.

The resulting thumbnail uses the default image type.

When the image is resized, the aspect ratio will be preserved.

When the specified dimensions does not have the same aspect ratio as the source image, the specified dimensions will be used as the absolute boundary of the thumbnail.

For example, if the source image of 100 pixels by 100 pixels, and the desired thumbnail size is 50 pixels by 100 pixels, then the resulting thumbnail will be 50 pixels by 50 pixels, as the constraint will be 50 pixels for the width, and therefore, by preserving the aspect ratio, the height will be required to be 50 pixels.

Parameters:
img - The source image.
width - The width of the thumbnail.
height - The height of the thumbnail.
Returns:
Resulting thumbnail.

createThumbnail

@Deprecated
public static Image createThumbnail(Image img,
                                               int width,
                                               int height)
Deprecated. This method has been moved to the Thumbnailator class, and is subject to removal in future versions of Thumbnailator.

Creates a thumbnail from an Image.

The resulting BufferedImage uses the default image type.

When the image is resized, the aspect ratio will be preserved.

When the specified dimensions does not have the same aspect ratio as the source image, the specified dimensions will be used as the absolute boundary of the thumbnail.

Parameters:
img - The source image.
width - The width of the thumbnail.
height - The height of the thumbnail.
Returns:
The thumbnail image as an Image.

Parameters:
